bug.short_desc: Atom layout not properly inheritance is working

long_desc.thetext:
if the qx.ui.layout.Atom is
iconPosition : { check : [ "left", "top", "right", "bottom", "top-left", "bottom-left" ], init : "left", apply : "_applyLayoutChange" },
and qx.ui.basic.Atom is
iconPosition : { init : "right", check : [ "top", "right", "bottom", "left", "top-left", "bottom-left" ], themeable : true, apply : "_applyIconPosition" },
= this results in left icon position init!
the init of layout manager overrides the init of Atom. This is not consistent as the Atom Icon position init is shadowed by the layout manager and is useless!
Reasonable would be that the Atom init of the iconPosition should be ruling if available.
Further testing seems to give that if a property is using the attribute 'init' then if an 'apply' attribute is defined at the same time it is NEVER called with the 'init' value! Must be a flaw.

(In reply to comment #1) > Further testing seems to give that if a property is using the attribute 'init' > then if an 'apply' attribute is defined at the same time it is NEVER called > with the 'init' value! Must be a flaw.
As strange as it sounds, that is a know behavior. If you want to have the apply called, you have to call the init method in the constructor of the class. That way, we can control if the apply should be called or not.
As for the other problem with the Atom, i need to check that out when I have more time.
